q1.question: Are electronic signatures legally binding?
q1.answer: Yes, electronic signatures provided through 123LegalDoc (powered by SignWell) are legally binding in the United States under the ESIGN Act and UETA, as well as in many other countries.

q2.question: Do my signers need a 123LegalDoc account?
q2.answer: No, recipients can sign documents you send them without needing to create an account. They simply click the link in their email.

q3.question: What file types can I upload for signing?
q3.answer: You can upload PDF, Microsoft Word (.doc, .docx), OpenOffice/LibreOffice (.odt), and plain text (.txt) files. We'll convert them for signing.

q4.question: Is my data secure?
q4.answer: Absolutely. We use bank-level AES-256 encryption for data in transit and at rest. Our platform is designed with security as a top priority.

q5.question: Can I track who has signed and who hasn't?
q5.answer: Yes, you'll have a dashboard to see the status of your documents in real-time, including who has viewed, signed, or if there are any pending signatures.

q6.question: Is 123LegalDoc (via SignWell) HIPAA compliant?
q6.answer: SignWell, our e-signature partner, offers features that can help organizations meet HIPAA compliance requirements, such as Business Associate Agreements (BAA) and robust security measures. However, achieving HIPAA compliance is a shared responsibility. Please contact us to discuss your specific needs for HIPAA if you handle Protected Health Information (PHI).
